_header: A woman that is willful is a plague of the worst
Note:
Formerly 108.7; cf. 3618; and cf. Wright and Halliwell-Phillipps (1845)
XThomas Wright, and James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps. Reliquiae Antiquae. 2 vols. London: Smith, 1845, 1.249.
_description: Fortunes according to cards, mainly satirical attacks against women — ten couplets from ‘an ancient set of ten fortune cards’

ChethamA472.First Lines:
A woman thatt ys wylfull ys a plage off the worsteas good lyue in
                    hell, and withe a wyffe that is curste…
ChethamA472.Last Lines:
…Chosse oute a matee thatt wyll leavue you a chossewith a rede
                    heade a sharpe nosse and a shrill voyce
ChethamA472.Note:
Copied into an antiquarian miscellancy by Thomas Barritt, c.
                    1800.
ChethamA472.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.195-6.
